title: Cow

verbs: Of a cow or bull, to make its characteristic lowing sound.
Make a low noise, characteristic of bovines
To draw milk from (a mammal, especially a cow).
To express milk from (a mammal, especially a cow).
nouns: The edible flesh of animals, especially that of mammals.
Meat is the flesh of an animal which is eaten.
Animal flesh used as food
Animal flesh eaten as food
Animal flesh used as food.
Meat is animal flesh that is eaten as food.
The flesh of an animal used as food.
The flesh of animals (including fishes and birds and snails) used as food
A white nutritious liquid secreted by mammals and used as food by human beings
Milk from a cow.
Milk is a white liquid produced by the mammary glands of mammals.
Milk that contains at least 3.5% fat.
The whitish fluid secreted by the mammary gland for the nourishment of the young; composed of carbohydrates, proteins, fats, mineral salts, vitamins, and antibodies.
Nutrient-rich liquids secreted by the mammary glands of female mammals
White liquid produced by the mammary glands of mammals

A white liquid produced by the mammary glands of female mammals to nourish their young. From certain animals, especially cows, it is a common food for humans as a beverage or used to produce various dairy products such as butter, cheese, and yogurt.
A dairy cow
Any bovine animal used as a beast of burden.
An ox, also known as a bullock in Australia, New Zealand and India, is a bovine trained as a draft animal.
Castrated adult male
Any bovine animal (tribe Bovini) used as a beast of burden
A bovine animal (bull or cow).
An adult castrated bull of the genus Bos; especially Bos taurus
Female of domestic cattle: "`moo-cow' is a child's term"
Sound made by a cow.
The sound made by a cow or bull
The characteristic sound made by a cow or bull.
Sound made by a cow or bull.

description:
A cow, a bovine farmed for its meat or milk. Depicted in full profile on all fours facing left with a black-and-white patched coat (as a Holstein Friesian) and, on many platforms, a pink udder and horns.

May be used to represent the animal, its food products, or black-and-white coloring. See also üêÆ Cow Face.

Microsoft's cow was previously brown, as was Facebook's, which had a bell around its neck.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the cow emoji is depicted with a friendly and gentle expression, its iconic black and white patches rendered with Apple‚Äôs characteristic glossy 3D shading and realistic lighting. The smooth, rounded form of its body and head, combined with soft gradients, gives it a charming and approachable appearance. This emoji is a delightful way to represent farm life, nature, or to add a touch of pastoral charm to digital conversations.
